Use: Dark Caracal 's version of Bandook communicates with their server over a TCP port using HTTP payloads Base64 encoded and suffixed with the string "&&&". [1]

Technique: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
Use: Dark Caracal 's version of Bandook adds a registry key to HKEY_USERS\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run for persistence. [1]

Technique: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell
Use: Dark Caracal has used macros in Word documents that would download a second stage if executed. [1]
Dark Caracal collected complete contents of the 'Pictures' folder from compromised Windows systems. [1]
Dark Caracal leveraged a watering hole to serve up malicious code. [1]
Dark Caracal collected file listings of all default Windows directories. [1]

Technique: Obfuscated Files or Information: Software Packing
Use: Dark Caracal has used UPX to pack Bandook . [1]

Technique: Obfuscated Files or Information: Encrypted/Encoded File
Use: Dark Caracal has obfuscated strings in Bandook by base64 encoding, and then encrypting them. [1]
Dark Caracal spearphished victims via Facebook and Whatsapp. [1]
Dark Caracal took screenshots using their Windows malware. [1]

Technique: System Binary Proxy Execution: Compiled HTML File
Use: Dark Caracal leveraged a compiled HTML file that contained a command to download and run an executable. [1]
Dark Caracal makes their malware look like Flash Player, Office, or PDF documents in order to entice a user to click on it. [1]
Dark Caracal controls implants using standard HTTP communication. [1]
